website_summaries.verdict: Even if you don't take advantage of its gaming prowess, the Nvidia Shield Tablet is one of the most versatile -- and affordable -- high-performance 8-inch Android slates you can buy.
pros: The Nvidia Shield Tablet packs a lot of graphics punch with a new Tegra K1 processor.
It has expandable microSD card storage
runs Android 5.0 Lollipop and offers full access to Google Play app store.
Its add-on wireless game controller enables connected TV support for sofa gaming and streaming-video entertainment.
It streams PC games with compatible gaming PCs
cons: Its plastic chassis feels a little cheap
there aren't many Android games that support the K1 graphics potential
the game controller required to play most games is sold separately

customer_reviews.title: Get this tablet instead of Samsung, 💯
customer_reviews.text: I loved this when I got it but the biggest issue is the startup. It gets so bogged down that you have to wait like 15 minutes for it to connect to the internet and get all of your alerts and blah blah blah before the processor is even ready to complete a task like streaming. Once it's ready though, I never have ANY problem streaming and playing games unless I happen to have poor internet connection. I love the size and portability (plus compatibility with all of my Android devices and favorite apps). If you're going to get a tablet that's not Apple, this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Fast gaming tablet
customer_reviews.text: Best tablet I have ever owned. It really neat to see a tablet run Half life 2 .Fastest gaming tablet out there unless the X1 has been released. The only downside is ,that it needs a bigger battery because if you are playing new title games the battery only last around a hour, but browsing the web it will last six to seven hours. I like the 8 inch screen and the front firing speakers. The pen to draw or paint with is cool, but I never have even used it. I like how you can set the CPU to run at what ever speed you want.
customer_reviews.author: elmorejohn46

customer_reviews.title: Bang-for-the-buck Winner!
customer_reviews.text: What a great tablet! Works perfectly and delivered Prime the next day! Pros: Best bang-for-the-buck tablet on the market, Super-fast, responsive, clean, powerful speakers, stylus included, works everywhere with Wifi. Cons: The power and volume buttons can be a bit tricky. I get around this by having a notebook-style case that covers the screen and magnets hold it on. Once I close that cover, screen turns off. When I open the cover, screen turns back on. All the volume controls can be reached in the on-screen menus Other thoughts: Get a protective case, and a full-glass screen protector. You'll thank me the 1st time you drop the tablet (and the 2nd, and the 3rd....)
customer_reviews.author: Lookin4Trouble

customer_reviews.title: Not A Good Device
customer_reviews.text: The Wi-Fi on this device has to be some of the worst I've ever used. Holding it horizontally results in lost connectivity when your hand passes over the antenna. Has a hard time maintaining a signal from less than 10 feet away while all other devices perform flawlessly. Slow and unresponsive. I received a new one because apparently the first wave of tablets sent out had a chance to turn into incindiary devices, and now my new tablet's touch screen is nearly completely unresponsive unless I am using the included stylus. Apps frequently crash and run incorrectly. I could go on and on about what I don't like about this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Colby M.

customer_reviews.title: Best Android tablet I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing as a tablet. The Nvidia gamestream etc is great too. I mainly bought this to play my pc games in the living room and remotely. Remote streaming is difficult to setup but that is to be expected i guess. In house streaming works great. The controller (sold separately) is worth it. An xbox controller and OTG cable works good as well, but some games behave incorrectly without the official controller. Plus the wireless, and headphone functionality of the controller are very useful. Kind of wish they made a 10" version, but this size is great for maintaining portability.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew D Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Nvidia did this one WRONG!
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but problems with this tablet. It constantly crashes, and sometimes it will not boot at all. When I'm playing a game it runs great as long as it doesn't crash. Don't get me wrong, this thing is powerful. But it's made cheap, and there are definitely problems with the tegra k1. Trying to gamestream with my alienware 17 with an nvidia 880m is a hassle to say the least. I have a dual-band router just for gamestreaming and i have never had any luck at all with gamestreaming to the nvidia tablet. And my computer hardware is more than enough to run anything at 60 fps. HUGE disappointment Nvidia!!
customer_reviews.author: Edwards

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend spending the extra couple of hundred dollars and getting ...
customer_reviews.text: It does play a lot of game well, but many games make the Tablet overheat leading it to crash. I would definitely recommend spending the extra couple of hundred dollars and getting a gaming laptop instead if you plan to game even on emulators such as blue stacks.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro L.

customer_reviews.title: Better, but still many nagging problems and sluggish launcher performance
customer_reviews.text: This might be a powerful gaming tablet, but when it comes to everyday tasks this tablet performs like a dog. I expected the supposedly high performance tablet would be responsive and quickly launch and switch apps. But it performs worse than my galaxy S3 phone. Stylus is nice for note taking but overall very disappointing. UPDATE 3 Jan 2015: After the latest Android 5.01 update just before Christmas it is performing MUCH better and I am pretty happy with it. Bumped up from 2 to 4 stars. UPDATE 24 Mar 2015: Seems to be deteriorating. Requires a hard reboot about once or twice a day.
customer_reviews.author: Jon C

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a high performance tablet, this is it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my GF and she loves it. Fastest tablet out there (until v2 ships) with great sounding front firing stereo speakers. EDIT: There was a recall on some of these units due to a faulty battery. Turns out ours was one of the affected units. Nvidia made the process relatively painless. We received a brand new unit (factory sealed in a new box) before having to return the old one, and they supplied the return shipping box and label. In spite of this, I still recommend this tablet. It has had some growing pains, but Nvidia is on top of it and seems to be taking care of its customers.
customer_reviews.author: TinyZombie

customer_reviews.title: Worst android experience. Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: My original one that I bought in 2014 was great. Buttery smooth and fast. It got recalled because of the battery and the replacement one has sucked. Freezes, randomly reboots, and apps crash. This is unfortunately a common issue if you search the threads. Ridiculous considering all the specs and how its made for gaming, but it can't even handle browsing and kindle. My moto x is a lot smoother. When it works its great. Just hate dealing with these issues every day.
customer_reviews.author: Joowon

customer_reviews.title: Best value tablet at this price level
customer_reviews.text: WiFi issues have been domain of Lollipop. I have same iffy WiFi issues on the Nexus 7 2012. Otherwise, great tablet for the price balance: * benchmarks faster than Nexus 9 * microSD and stylus * very regular updates by Nvidia (5.1 OTA currently) * I got it late in the manufacturing cycle so there's no "screen-cracking" issues * GRID games The IPS LED seems a bit washed out compared to the AMOLED Galaxy S4, but only when you directly compare. Also, some 3D apps will have graphics glitches due to bad app QA between Qualcomm and Nvidia drivers.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: I like this device
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the recalled ones with the Y01 battery. I got it replaced. This device works well. Sadly though, there doesn't seem to be anymore update support for this device despite the fact that it is running stock android. The battery life is kinda dismal at times and the 2GB of RAM isn't quite enough as my tablet sometimes lags. Also, HDMI out at times can be a pain to get working. When trying to watch a Play Movie, sometimes it will show an information screen on the TV and the movie on the device. Despite all this, I like this device. It is a great size, the stylus works nicely and it is stock android.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Meschke

customer_reviews.title: Sweet tablet.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! I am so glad I held out for this over the original Shield. This tablet is 8" but fits my hand like my old 7" I have the controller as well and streaming to my TV is no sweat. It does get a little warm when gaming for a while but to excessive. Over all the performance has exceeded my expectations. Happy buyer here.
customer_reviews.author: K. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Great mobile device for gamers
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Tablet. I have owned several different tablets over the years, but this has to be my favorite. I love the features that come standard, along with the responsiveness in games. The game stream work surprisingly well without noticeable lag, and I was able to beat several high end games via game stream (like Tomb Raider). When the battery fiasco happened I received my replacement within a few days, and have only been more pleased with a more functional tablet!
customer_reviews.author: Niklaus Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet that is bad at what it was built for
customer_reviews.text: Major problems streaming even with a router recommended by Nvidia. I ended up liking it for features other than what I bought it for including the stylus, the screen, and the mini HDMI (for Netflix or demoing things). For streaming games, with a GTX 770 and an Asus router, it is pretty much garbage. The tablet needs to be about three feet from the router to work and I have spent plenty of time troubleshooting, ensuring the tablet is up to date, and reading about it online. Not everyone has this problem, from what I have read, but personally, I stopped trying to stream any games to my TV.
customer_reviews.author: Eidolon 5

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet... if you can find one that works!
customer_reviews.text: First tablet died after a few hours with the screen going crazy white as if it was burnt on the inside. The second one that was delivered works fine, however take into consideration that some people on the official nvidia channel keep commenting that they had to RMA their tablet quite a few times and they still have issues with it. It all depends on your luck, if you do land one that works (like mine) then you'll be surprised by how powerful the hardware is.
customer_reviews.author: Andrei Dragan

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I have a few issues: 1) Sometimes, when I log in, after I've been using it in pen-only mode, it will not accept touchscreen input and I have to reboot. 2) It has rebooted on its own a few times. 3) The pen-only mode is not perfect. It will pick up my palm sometimes. Other than these things, I like it alot.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew W. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Wifi problems
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this tablet is great... exexcept one of the most important parts. The wifi on this tablet is absolutely horrendous. Both 2.4 and 5 connections are laughably bad. My old iPhone 3 and galaxy s4 both connect without a problem, but the tablet for some reason refuses to have a stable connection. If it was not for this one problem this tablet would be great, but for a tablet meant to stream games over wifi having issues with the wifi is, well, just sad quite honestly. I cannot recommend this tablet for that sole reason.
customer_reviews.author: nikonuke

customer_reviews.title: I would buy 2 if I could use 2 at a time!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tablet, I swiched to this from an iPad 4 and I do not regret it. This things camera is unreal! Battery life is good, not too big, not to small in size. Perfect for having in your backpack to bring to work, school, or traveling. Haven't noticed any defects on it, and the screen is calibrated accurately. Definately worth it if you are into gaming on the go, or even at home! Sometimes I choose to play this thing over my Xbox One when I'm at home. The game quality isn't as good as the Xbox One obviously, but still the games are fun and enjoyable to play. Also the front speakers make the sounds clear and thrilling!
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet, much better than anything out there
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tablet, much better than anything out there; iPad, Samsung in its price point. Can support 4k pass through but what makes this tablet great is the games that are on the grid - I finished Witcher 2 all over again and it was amazing fun on 52" plasma through mini HDMI. The latest firmware has fixed all the issues and the speed is great. I would recommend this for anyone planning on buying a small tablet over anything else out there.
customer_reviews.author: Farid Jamal

customer_reviews.title: It's an excellent small tablet with extra bells and whistles that makes ...
customer_reviews.text: Very fast and very responsive. It's an excellent small tablet with extra bells and whistles that makes it even more of a bargain compared with other tablets. Currently my only complaint is that the auto brightness can be a little off, but I'm certain that will be patched with time (or I am overly sensitive to it). As for the power and volume buttons being difficult to use - it gets much better (read, used to it) once you've used it for a week or two.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The best android gaming tablet
customer_reviews.text: The best android gaming tablet; impressive battery life, good durability, and runs every android game ever on max settings with a good framerate. I got the hairline cracks in the edges of the plastic corners, but its been almost a year and they have no damaged its build quality at all, they seem entirely aesthetic. It's also awesome just as an ordinary, non gaming tablet. What's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: Penn

customer_reviews.title: Love this tablet for gaming! Will buy the next version!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT gaming platform. So much so that I will IMMEDIATELY but the next nvidia tablet with the Tegra X1 chip (Maxwell 2.0 graphics VS this tablet's Kepler. Maxwell is faster and uses a fraction of the power!) At best, battery life sucks, so always be near a wall or lipo emergency charger. It uses so much power gaming that it will out-draw a USB 3, 5v 2.0amp supply set to quick charge.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Generally very good, some minor issues
customer_reviews.text: So far it works very well: the amount of bloatware is minimal, almost pure android experience I was looking for, front speakers have a great sound, tab feels solidly built and all my apps run well. Only two cons on my side: - tab feels significantly heavier than I expected, it felt uncomfortable to be holded in my hands for longer time without resting - when running computation heavy tasks like games or movies it becomes very warm and significantly drains the battery, more than other pads I had
customer_reviews.author: Piotr Powalowski

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance for a High price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't liked this tablet almost since I bought it. Now 15 month later it won't even charge. Its a piece of crap. And it was also acting up prior to that by the screen suddenly turning to the wrong direction, games freezing, extra long loading times and constant updates that caused slow down of apps. I bought another one for much cheaper and already like it ten times better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Miracast Does Not work.  It conflicts with the wireless controller, so Nvidia disabled it.
customer_reviews.text: The nvidia tablet does not work with Miracast. It conflicts with the wireless controller, so Nvidia quietly disabled it, while leaving the option and feature in the menus. I wasted way too much time debugging everything, only to find a forum post from Nvidia admitting that they disabled it. Other than that, it crashes a lot. Every few months, completely erase it and go back to factory settings and it will work well until you need to do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Flippers

customer_reviews.title: Best Tablet own the market
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tablet. If you looking for a really good and affordable tablet. The Nvidia Shield Tablet is the 1 for you. At first it stuck quite often and I started to re grate that i bought this tablet. But about a month ago there was a software update and it has been working extremely well after. Its really fast and graphics is awesome. It also comes witha stylus pen which is really premium built, the stylus alone can sell for almost $30.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Works as a mobile gaming unit but would probably not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Lags more than I would have hoped for such a high end product. Also freezes on occasion. I've heard that it's a problem with Android Lollipop, but it sucks anyway. Kind of heavy and battery life is barely adequate. Runs games smoothly and I like the stylus. I have the shield controller and it's interface with this tablet is a disappointment. Hooks up to HDMI but cuts off the borders of the screen. Hoping for a better product and did not meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Kuei Chao

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, just had a small issue
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this but am in the process of getting it replaced. Mine didn't have any of the issues everyone else talks about except for the short battery life which isn't the worst of my problems. My issue is that the battery seems to have swelled like batteries do over time. This is as bad as a two year battery and I've only had it for three weeks. That caused the back to start to pop off and won't snap back together for any significant amount of time. Because of that, it seems to restart, I'm guessing because the battery loses contact. It does work really well other than the issue I experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Aimed for work
customer_reviews.text: just as I expected and more... I am not a "mobile gamer" only a hard core gamer and enjoy retro gaming,so this tablet was adquired for work purposes, viewing acad blueprints, short presentation, video training, and alike, and this tablet has configuration for the 4 cores of the processor, you can enable them per app! it is great, the only minor understandable drawback is the battery life, the 4 core processor consumes it relentlessly. I'm very happy with my purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: ricKter2099

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it's fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: As stated, the tablet is quick, responsive and the stylus is impressively accurate - when the tablet functions properly. Quickly updated to lollipop. Cons: occasionally lags horribly - especially when operating with multiple users. During certain operations (typically drawing), the screen glitches and shows odd pixelating as if having a graphic driver issue. Occasionally refuses to boot. It requires a frustratingly mystical combination of randomly charging and pressing/long-pressing the power button and volume buttons to get it to fire up. Sometimes this results in accessing the device's safe mode menu but at least it then functions after the reboot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... well built and the screen and graphics are as good as expected
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is very well built and the screen and graphics are as good as expected. The downside is that it freezes in the middle of watching a movie, for example, and I have to force reboot the device. Also, the performance isn't as great as you would expect from this specs. What I do love about this tablet is the speakers, as they are front facing, they have bass and good volume for a space so small.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: the size and weight are perfect (dont like big tablets) and the hdmi is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Everything is well done, the size and weight are perfect (dont like big tablets) and the hdmi is awesome, I use as a streaming box in hotels (I travel a lot) so I don't depend on hotel tv anymore and I also use for powerpoint presentations. In at least 50% of my work trips I can leave my laptop and just take this tablet. It's fit for gaming... but I never used for this!! It's a productivity tool for me. Good screen, stilus is great and battery is also very good.
customer_reviews.author: FHFL

customer_reviews.title: Screen flickers, runs slowly (maybe due to slow CPU or RAM?)
customer_reviews.text: The screen flickers more than my ASUS Transformer, and is VERY touch-sensitive. The included stylus is nice, although I don't find that I use it very much. It's a nice and light, good sized tablet. I don't think the fact it's shell is made of plastic is such a drawback (I saw this in another post). The processor seems slow, since load-times are laggy. It doesn't measure up with Apple, by any means. For the price, however, it's a decent little email/gaming tablet. I hope it lasts longer than my ASUS Transformer (1 warranty service after screen died, and has died again after 12 months, or so).
customer_reviews.author: Lennart Bentsen

customer_reviews.title: Review after a few years of use
customer_reviews.text: The battery goes bad after about a year or so. You will need to charge it multiple times a day for light use. Get used to that "15 % battery remaining" warning, you will see it constantly. For games, it has simply been ok. If you are looking for a gaming tablet, I would look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Paul from Massachusetts

customer_reviews.title: Great in paper. Mediocre in the pitch.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this tablet for about a year and I regret having purchased it. It worked great for the first few months; a bit of lag here and there, but nothing serious. Then the lag started impacting more and more apps more and more often. It's got to the point where I need to shut it down daily because it freezes. Nvidia were onto something with Grid and the game controller, but this tablet is a mediocre execution of a device within a service platform that the industry isn't yet ripe to provide.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: My son and I love it in terms of gaming performance and graphics plus ...
customer_reviews.text: My son and I love it in terms of gaming performance and graphics plus good console mode response. (i7 CPU, 780Ti with Nighthawk router; I use Wifi throughout and no wire connection involved when in console streaming mode). Don't go too far from the router and recommend sitting the tablet right next to it as signal received from router dropped quiet significantly. I supposed it's the Wifi receiver performance of the tablet instead of my router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turns off for no reason
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine tablet with great value.....when it works. It frequently turns off without warning and the battery drains without an explanation. Seems to be the case for other owners of the device. Amazon did their part and replaced it with another NVIDIA Shield tablet, but I'm experiencing the same issue with the new tablet. I don't know what the reason is, but hope they fix it.
customer_reviews.author: MOON SOO SHIN

customer_reviews.title: but I love it. I personally haven't owned a ipad
customer_reviews.text: Only had this tablet for a week, but I love it. I personally haven't owned a ipad, but I've used many of them, and I prefer android vs iOS. Their are far less constrictions. This tablet also doesn't lag at all. It works well with every feature it says it has. The grid is fantastic! All you need is a wifi connection and you can play from a list of games for FREE (until July). The list included both Borderlands 1 and 2, and both Darksiders games. With all of that, I feel this is definitely worth the price tag it has.
customer_reviews.author: UnluckyGoodguy

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet but.....
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tablet. My husband really enjoys it for gaming and other browsing the internet. We have already had to contact customer service with an issue regarding the tablet with less than 3 months of use, and all I can say is they suck when it comes to fixing things. It has been almost a month and our issue is still not resolved yet. I'm beginning to wish I had purchased a different tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Tay

customer_reviews.title: For those unable to get the prime instant video app to work on the shield
customer_reviews.text: Do not download the Amazon instant video app from the Google app store and if you have delete it along with the Amazon store app. Now go to the Amazon app store and download the Amazon market app and then download the prime instant video app, install and you'll be able to stream your movies and videos from prime. It took me forever to figure this out and wanted to pass it along.
customer_reviews.author: S7N

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: i love it, if you have a couples of games opened at the background the tablet can went a little slow, but if you care just to have one heavy app at the time you wont have that trouble. Also the camera app takes a bit to show of the view. The battery life can be inproved.. using trine it almost depleted the battery in 3 hours.. for everything else it work pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: GBM2012

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: So far it's everything that you would expect from an nvidia product, which is amazing. It's very fast and handles everything perfectly. The only issue I have is that the power button (as mentioned in other reviews) is kinda smooshy and doesn't feel like you pressed anything when pressed. Otherwise it's a great product, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: great screen quality
customer_reviews.text: Very fast tablet for gaming, great screen quality. I love that I can install a microSD card and increase my storage space. I have a 64Gb card in right now and it's great. The only drawback I would say is it takes longer than I would hope moving from one app to another and it seems to lag a bit coming back from not being in use. I had a Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 8.0 running Cyanogenmod and moving between apps felt a lot faster with that despite it being much older.
customer_reviews.author: ConsumerMan

customer_reviews.title: I really like it but there are issues
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the tablet for about a month or two now. I really like it but there are issues. Wifi connection is great so I think that problem was fixed. Buttons are hard to press. Sound is good. Becomes unresponsive at times. I have to do resets multiple times a week. Game performance is great but I haven't played any controller games yet. Mainly just Hearthstone.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Lee Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Keeps bricking.  Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love it, but it keep bricking on me fairly regularly. (Screen black, no response.) Takes several minutes of holding down the power button to get it to fire up. When you need to use it, and it's not available, doesn't make for a handy device. Tech support didn't have any clue. Considering returning it. Maybe they'll fix it in later versions.
customer_reviews.author: FitForLife

customer_reviews.title: Could have been great
customer_reviews.text: It would be perfect. It lags and locks up anytime you have more than two apps open. I am constantly closing apps and it still feels very slow. My HTC One M8 seems much faster and I tend to use it more because I don't want to deal with the lagging tablet. I don't have any problems with the WiFi as other people are posting. I also have problems with it not wanting to turn on. I will probably return it and try a different brand of tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Teebo

customer_reviews.title: This tablet is amazing in everyway you could want a gaming focused tablet ...
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is amazing in everyway you could want a gaming focused tablet to be. With only one problem. I had three die on my from what I understand to be a battery issue. Three. When they worked I loved them they did everything I wanted and they did fast. Then they would just turn off and never power back on. If you are looking for a tablet in this size get one of these before you get an iPad mini.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Poss

customer_reviews.title: Want a Extend Display Option.
customer_reviews.text: Nvidia, make an option to extend the display alongside the mirroring option. I would like to have the option to just use the tablet as the keyboard, trackpad, or as a controller when connected through hdmi or wirelessly casting without it displaying the keyboard on the TV when input is requested. This takes up to much of the screen real estate on an external monitor and depreciates the productivity or overall usefulness of "casting". C'mon, Nvidia..you make graphic cards, make it happen. Other than that, this is a beast of a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: B.Harvest

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hardware
customer_reviews.text: I definitely am enjoying this piece of hardware. It makes playing emulators way bettere with the implementation of the shield controller. Didn't need any applications to run other controller you just couldn't charge if you wanted to use a Xbox controller. Streaming games from my PC works good also Nvidia grid even though it's in beta is smooth as long as you have a strong Internet connection. But overall satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: BMB

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while then had to send it back ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a while then had to send it back to company for replacement. Frequent problem I'm told. 2nd unit has been working well since.
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for movies or games
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband and he loves it! He got the associated controller, SD card, and case too. He has really enjoyed it for game playing, much to my surprise, and the variety of ways to get games on and off this device (to the tv) have contributed. He also likes it as a tablet for movies, email, etc. It's a very clean interface and very snappy.
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: great but imperfect
customer_reviews.text: Fast, reliable and can last even on heavy usage. Its better than ipad in my opinion. But it has quite a few flaws. The screen responsiveness significantly drops when being charged. It crashes sometimes and writing on a memory card takes quite a tweak and peek before making it work. I dont like the photo viewer google made too. This thing is really made for gaming though.
customer_reviews.author: Melo.

customer_reviews.title: 2 Months in, the battery is draining rapidly (dropped ...
customer_reviews.text: 2 Months in, the battery is draining rapidly (dropped 15% within hour after full charge cycle, light load - only Android core programs running) The OS keeps crashing too and the touch screen becomes unresponsive too often. I'm going back to my old Nexus 7
customer_reviews.author: asdjfk

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: The battery only stays charged for about 3 mins and then it turns off. We didn’t even get a chance to really see the screen quality or use the touch screen
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.text: The tablet is simply the most powerful tablet on the market. The price is excellent. I really love it. Why not 5 stars? Because of the battery. To be honest, if you listen to music online, playing games and skyping a lot, it will last for like 3 hours. That's sad, because I'm active skype user. product_meta.title: NVIDIA SHIELD Tablet (WiFi)
product_meta.description:
The NVIDIA SHIELD tablet delivers the perfect mix of power, portability, and performance. Its NVIDIA Tegra K1 mobile processor taps into the same Kepler architecture that drives the world's most extreme gaming PCs. Plus, it features NVIDIA GameStream technology that lets you take PC gaming everywhere. Unbelievable graphics and audio make every song, music, game, and podcast incredibly crisp and clear. Pair it with the optional SHIELD controller and discover a whole new level of gaming performance and control. Aspiring artists can even use the GPU-accelerated NVIDIA DirectStylus 2 to for great writing, or get creative with the NVIDIA Dabbler app’s hyper-realistic watercolor and 3D Paint.
